intro: Silene keiskei f. leucantha, commonly known as the white-flowered bladder campion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and easily identifiable species within its genus.
